channel.title: Wolff Olins on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Wolff Olins on Logotyp.us

item.title: AOL
item.description: AOL (stylized as Aol., formerly a company known as AOL Inc. and originally known as America Online) is an American web portal and online service provider based in New York City. It is a brand marketed by Verizon Media. Source Source

item.title: BHF
item.description: The British Heart Foundation (BHF) is a charity organisation in the United Kingdom. It funds research to beat heartbreak from heart and circulatory diseases and their risk factors. Source

item.title: Enel
item.description: Enel S.p.A., or the Enel Group, is an Italian multinational energy company that is active in the sectors of electricity generation and distribution, as well as in the distribution of natural gas. Source Source

item.title: Grubhub
item.description: Grubhub Inc. is an American online and mobile food ordering and delivery marketplace that connects diners with local takeout restaurants. Based in Chicago, as of Q1 2019 the company has 19.9 million active users and 115,000 associated restaurants across 2,200 cities in the United States. Source Source

item.title: Meraas
item.description: Meraas is a holding company based in Dubai with operations and assets in the United Arab Emirates. Source Source

item.title: TATA
item.description: Tata Group (/ˈtɑːtɑː/) is an Indian multinational conglomerate holding company headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Founded in 1868 by Jamsetji Tata, the company gained international recognition after purchasing several global companies. One of India’s largest conglomerates, Tata Group is owned by Tata Sons. Source Source

item.title: Team Knowhow
item.description: Team Knowhow believe everyone has the right to expert help with all technology. That’s why, whatever it is and wherever you bought it, we’ll help you get more from the kit that matters most to you. When you’re looking for something new, Team Knowhow nationwide team of in-store experts offers friendly, impartial advice – and Team Knowhow’ll help you get it home and set it up with no fuss.

item.title: The Met
item.description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art of New York City, colloquially “the Met”, is the largest art museum in the United States. With 6,953,927 visitors to its three locations in 2018, it was the third most visited art museum in the world. Source

item.title: Uniliver
item.description: Unilever is a British-Dutch transnational consumer goods company co-headquartered in London, United Kingdom, and Rotterdam, Netherlands. Its products include food and beverages (about 40 per cent of its revenue), cleaning agents, beauty products, and personal care products. It is Europe’s seventh most valuable company. Unilever is one of the oldest multinational companies; its products are available in around 190 countries. Source Source

item.title: USA Today
item.description: USA Today is an internationally distributed American daily, middle-market newspaper that serves as the flagship publication of its owner, the Gannett Company. The newspaper has a generally centrist audience.[3] Founded by Al Neuharth on September 15, 1982, it operates from Gannett’s corporate headquarters on Jones Branch Drive, in McLean, Virginia.[4] It is printed at 37 sites across the United States and at five additional sites internationally. Its dynamic design influenced the style of local, regional, and national newspapers worldwide, through its use of concise reports, colorized images, informational graphics, and inclusion of popular culture stories, among other distinct features.

item.title: Virgin Media
item.description: Virgin Media Limited is a British company which provides telephone, television and internet services in the United Kingdom. Its headquarters are in Hook, Hampshire. Since 2013, Virgin Media has been a subsidiary of Liberty Global plc, an international television and telecommunications company. The company was previously listed on the NASDAQ Stock Market and London Stock Exchange. Virgin Media is not a sister company of Virgin Mobile USA, which is owned by Sprint Corporation

item.title: Zocdoc
item.description: Zocdoc is an online medical care appointment booking service, providing free of charge medical care search facility for end users by integrating information about medical practices and doctors individual schedules in a central location. The company is based in New York City, with offices in Scottsdale, Arizona and Pune, India. Source Source

item.title: Uber
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. is an American multinational transportation network company (TNC) offering services that include peer-to-peer ridesharing, ride service hailing, food delivery, and a bicycle-sharing system. The company is based in San Francisco and has operations in 785 metropolitan areas worldwide. Its platforms can be accessed via its websites and mobile apps. Source Uber typography is as unique and easy to use as Uber are. Inspired by the world’s best used transportation examples, it was designed to maximize its impact across all applications while keeping it easy to read, ownable, and highly recognizable.

item.title: General Electric
item.description: General Electric Company (GE) is an American multinational conglomerate incorporated in New York City and headquartered in Boston. As of 2018, the company operates through the following segments: aviation, healthcare, power, renewable energy, digital industry, additive manufacturing, venture capital and finance, lighting, and oil and gas. Source
